bio: Kathleen Dollard is a consultant, author, trainer, and speaker. She's been a Microsoft MVP for over ten years and has spoken about .NET in 28 states and 5 countries. She's written dozens of articles including the
column in Visual Studio Magazine. She also wrote

(Apress). Her passion is helping programmers be smarter in how they develop by learning to better use .NET languages, libraries and platforms. She works with WPF, WF, as well as core technologies including System.AddIn. She's currently creating template infrastructure for code generation using VB XML literals. After working on the problem of capturing business intent in metadata and test definitions for years, she's working with industry improvements in these areas. She's also working on full life cycle improvements, such as unit testing, better debugging and static analysis (FxCop). When not working, she enjoys woodworking, snowshoeing, and kayaking depending on the outdoor temperature. Kathleen's blog, Leaning into Windows, can be found at [http://msmvps.com/blogs/kathleen](http://msmvps.com/blogs/kathleen/) and she can be found on Twitter as @[KathleenDollard](http://twitter.com/KathleenDollard).
